awd_titl_txt: Inter-Tribal Education Coalition - Rural Systemic Initiative
awd_abstract_narration: 9554458      The project will conduct a regional self-study to determine optimum  strategies to accomplish systemic educational reform and economic  development in a region characterized by high poverty and lack of  resources.  The principal investigator has established a coalition  among American Indian education centers, tribal education boards,  reservations, state agencies and NSF systemic initiatives in the  region that includes California, Nevada and Arizona.  The  development phase will result in an implementation plan that  addresses the barriers faced by American Indian students in the  region, and capitalizes on opportunities to create community based  support for equitable access to science, mathematics, engineering  and technology education.  The strategies employed will include  local, regional and multi-State conferences, bringing together the  key education and community stakeholders.  ***

inst.inst_name: American Indian Center of Central California (AICCC)

perf_inst.perf_inst_name: American Indian Center of Central California (AICCC)
